DOC.brief_summary: Patients routinely give steroid eye drop follow cataract surgery . This study compare 2 approved drop : Loteprednol Etabonate versus Prednisolone Acetate Eye drop use follow cataract surgery . Patients randomly assign one drop , evaluated inflammation intraocular pressure part comparison . The study Doctor mask drop patient receive avoid bias .
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison 0.5 % Loteprednol Etabonate Versus 1 % Prednisolone Acetate Following Cataract Surgery
DOC.criteria: Subjects age 18 old undergoing routine cataract surgery . 1 . Subjects treat elevated intraocular pressure , retinopathy , maculopathy , cornea vitreous opacity would interfere visual acuity . 2 . Subjects diabetes , pseudoexfoliation , uveitis , corneal endothelial disease , active Herpes Simplex Virus ( HSV ) Herpes Zoster Virus ( HZV ) Pupil Stretch and/or Limbal Relaxing Incision ( LRIs ) allow . 3 . Subjects previous ocular trauma intraocular surgery 4 . Subjects sensitivities steroid . 5 . Women postmenopausal child bear potential exclude . 6 . Intraoperative complication surgery include posterior capsule rupture vitreous loss 7 . Subjects best visual potential fellow eye worse 20/60 8 . Subjects expect require concurrent ocular systemic therapy nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug ( NSAIDS ) mast cell stabilizer , antihistamine , decongestant within 2 day prior 21 day follow surgery . ( Intraoperative NSAIDS mydriasis permit . ) 325 mg Aspirin permit . 9 . Subjects expect require concurrent ocular systemic corticosteroid , immunosuppressant ( include Restasis ) within 14 day prior 21 day follow surgery
DOC.keyword: Intraocular Inflammation follow routine Cataract Surgery
